node.title: Invalid Function Error
node.bodyText:
The error message in my log says:
*** ERROR ***
Invalid function
ev_Jd(Ac+B(1-c)+Cclog(c)+D*(1-c)log(1-c)+
Ec*(1-c)+Fc(1-c)(2c-1)+Gc(1-c)(2c-1)^2)
c
in ParsedMaterialHelper.
Syntax error: Unknown identifier�[39m
application called MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1) - process 0
I'm new to MOOSE, is this saying my c variable is unknown? It's declared in my [Variables]. I've attached my input file. Thank you for any help for a poor newbie. I'm running this on a parallel computing network which I schedule via a slurm batch. The MOOSE environment is recently installed using conda.
FeCr.txt
log_slurm.txt

node.title: Question about initial condition setting
node.bodyText:
Hi everyone,
I want to divide the whole mesh as a 3*3 grid. The initial condition of each small square should be phi=0+randomly generated value,
how to set this initial condition?
(The following is the model I want)

I found that IsolatedBoundingBoxIC can divide the whole mesh to small square/rectangular and we can set different initial condition value to each small square/rectangular, however, it seems that this initial value can only be a certain value, it can not be set as randomly generated value in a range. How can I set a randomly generated value as the initial value in each small square/rectangular?
(The following is IsolatedBoundingBoxIC)

I also found that, using RandomIC can generate random value based on some distribution as the initial condition. How can I combine this with IsolatedBoundingBoxIC to set random generated value in each small box?
(The following is RandomIC)

Thank you very much,
Best,

Hello
we don’t have that one premade. You can code a randomBoxesIC that does what you want.
Guillaume
How to code a randomBoxesIC? Does this need any specific language?

C++
MOOSE is open source and you can make any new object you want. This includes initial conditions

node.title: Eigenvalue analysis of waveguide in 1D periodic structures
node.bodyText:
Hi,
Is it possible to do output eigenvalues of a waveguide in a periodic domain? (1D domain with periodic boundary conditions)
I have attached a description of the problem below. E and rho are the material properties, k and omega the wavenumber and frequency. I would like to output the wavenumbers for a frequency sweep and create a dispersion.
Reference .pdf
Thanks!
@cticenhour any thoughts on this?

Hi @obelix333 - there is an example I made for the calculation of a fundamental eigenvalue for 2D waveguide profiles (circular, coaxial, rectangular, etc.) in the electromagnetics module that you potentially could adapt to your scenario. Here's the link to a discussion of the benchmark, which compares MOOSE EM module results to analytical solutions and an older FEM code: https://mooseframework.inl.gov/benchmarks/WaveguideEigenvalue.html
The input files associated with this are located in the moose repository at: moose/modules/electromagnetics/test/tests/benchmarks/eigenvalue_problems
Take a look through this and the input files, and feel free to ask me more questions about it.

Thanks @cticenhour.
I will go through this example. Is it possible to output the matrices used to solve the eigen value problem in moose?

Does -ksp_view_mat do what you want?
There's also a petsc option to dump it to csv.
You ll want to look at the petsc manual for more on these

I aim to use the coefficients matrices to solve a second order eigenvalue problem in MATLAB.
I tried using -ksp_view_mat, but it outputs a bunch of lines in console. Is it possible to export it to csv?

yeah there's an option to dump it the matlab format actually.
I dont recall, please search the PETSC manual. Or maybe @oanaoana knows
I will look in the PETSC manual. Thanks @GiudGiud

Hi,
After going through the PETSc manaul, I found out the options for saving matrices and vectors to a .m file (to be read in MATLAB). However, is it possible to identify which kernel the matrices belong to?

All the contributions from all the kernels are agglomerated.
If you want to look at just one contribution, you ll have to use the vector_tag and matrix_tag parameters. Though it will only get you the residual and/or the diagonal of the Jacobian. You can look at it as a field then using the TagVector/MatrixAux to fill an auxvariable
Thanks! I don't think that would help me solve for eigenvalues, or would it? I might be missing something, being new to the MOOSE framework.

Oh no that won’t be enough.
If you develop, you can use a matrix tag then output the matrix tag to output the matrix to csv
Thank you so much @GiudGiud.

node.title: Wasp undefined reference
node.bodyText:
I am helping @philipJFpfahl compile Cardinal (with MOOSE's conda), but they are hitting a bunch of errors like this
/home/philip/mambaforge3/envs/moose/wasp/include/waspcore/Interpreter.i.h:206: undefined reference to `wasp::HITParser::HITParser(wasp::AbstractInterpreter&, std::istream&, std::shared_ptr<wasp::HITLexerImpl>)'
/home/philip/mambaforge3/envs/moose/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-conda-linux-gnu/10.4.0/../../../../x86_64-conda-linux-gnu/bin/ld: /home/philip/mambaforge3/envs/moose/wasp/include/waspcore/Interpreter.i.h:213: undefined reference to `wasp::HITParser::parse()'
/home/philip/mambaforge3/envs/moose/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-conda-linux-gnu/10.4.0/../../../../x86_64-conda-linux-gnu/bin/ld: /home/philip/mambaforge3/envs/moose/wasp/include/waspcore/Interpreter.i.h:206: undefined reference to `wasp::HITParser::~HITParser()'
/home/philip/mambaforge3/envs/moose/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-conda-linux-gnu/10.4.0/../../../../x86_64-conda-linux-gnu/bin/ld: /home/philip/mambaforge3/envs/moose/wasp/include/waspcore/Interpreter.i.h:206: undefined reference to `wasp::HITParser::~HITParser()'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
gmake[1]: *** [Makefile:22: hit] Error 1
make: *** [/home/philip/Documents/DTU/MOOSE/cardinal/contrib/moose/framework/moose.mk:138: /home/philip/Documents/DTU/MOOSE/cardinal/contrib/moose/framework/contrib/hit/hit.so] Error 2
make: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....

Does anyone have an idea for a workaround? Thanks!

Hello
Did you git clean -xfd the MOOSE directory?
Basically we ve gone through 2 versions of wasp, so older objects can be linked to the older one
Guillaume

Hello,
Thank you for the answers.
Here is the output
commit a5448feab86faf38793b6922bbebc9d996b597dd (HEAD -> devel, origin/devel, origin/HEAD)
Merge: 1d6d2507 ba5739b5
Author: April Novak <novak@berkeley.edu>
Date:   Thu May 18 14:35:55 2023 -0700

    Merge pull request #698 from aprilnovak/enum
    
    Remove nek_mesh parameter from NekRSSeparateDomainProblem

Author: aprilnovak <novak@berkeley.edu>
Date:   Thu May 18 14:19:33 2023 -0500

    Use enum for nekRS mesh and unexpose to user in NekRSSeparateDomainProblem.

commit 1d6d25075baa96b14dc8e3d3f52bff2485cb9120
Merge: adea4720 7d296388
Author: April Novak <novak@berkeley.edu>
Date:   Thu May 18 13:06:00 2023 -0700

    Merge pull request #699 from aprilnovak/removed-fixed
    
    Remove fixed_mesh from postprocessors

commit 7d296388a32f8d10cba1f515bcc2dcae9a965ca8
Author: aprilnovak <novak@berkeley.edu>
Date:   Thu May 18 14:03:01 2023 -0500

    Remove fixed_mesh from postprocessors

commit adea4720f0ab5d9acb225ecf3064e2bbbf4ce5b5
Merge: 50439311 2dd3ab5a
Author: April Novak <novak@berkeley.edu>
Date:   Thu May 18 11:11:15 2023 -0700

    Merge pull request #697 from aprilnovak/update-moose
    
    Update MOOSE

commit 2dd3ab5a08d3211e06aad530fac65b66e0eb850d
Author: April Novak <novak@berkeley.edu>
Date:   Thu May 18 09:58:09 2023 -0700

    Update potassium

commit 05d1e99282569069094fa409579fc9358b447eb3
Author: April Novak <novak@berkeley.edu>
Date:   Thu May 18 09:57:49 2023 -0700

    Update iapws

commit a2ab477d968e77956693d8c81f9a6538d2b702f5
Author: April Novak <novak@berkeley.edu>
Date:   Thu May 18 09:57:30 2023 -0700
:

@GiudGiud
I deleted the old MOOSE dir and reinstalled conda and then set up a new MOOSE environment.
Thank you
Philip

@GiudGiud, I already had Philip also do a completely fresh clone of Cardinal, so there shouldn't be any non-versioned files (e.g. git clean) hanging around. I also tried to reproduce his error on my machine (Mac) with this Cardinal hash, but could not.

@philipJFpfahl, you are using the MOOSE submodule in Cardinal, right? I just want to check that you are not manually setting MOOSE_DIR to point somewhere else? If you are, then that version may be in need of updating.
If it s not moose I d go wipe the conda environment in case something got messed up there.
If it s not moose I d go wipe the conda environment in case something got messed up there.

@aprilnovak can you explain what you mean by the MOOSE submodule in Cardinal? I don't point to a new dir deliberately. moose should be installed in ../moose
The MOOSE version in my conda environment should be new.
commit d38411d7b2d343afaa53afc1e36373f82aae49dc (HEAD -> master, origin/master)
Merge: 18ac9ad003 b9c8e604ca
Author: moosetest <bounces@inl.gov>
Date:   Fri May 12 23:20:44 2023 -0600

    Merge commit 'b9c8e604ca417526aacf5779b79226c

@philipJFpfahl can you try
conda deactivate
conda env remove -n moose
conda create -n moose
<open a new terminal window>
conda activate moose
mamba install moose-libmesh moose-tools

and then repeat those steps (starting from deleting the Cardinal directory) I listed on the Cardinal discussion page?
I think we can use moose-dev now instead moose-libmesh moose-tools

@aprilnovak Yes,
I did:
rm -rf cardinal/
git clone https://github.com/neams-th-coe/cardinal.git
cd cardinal
./scripts/get-dependencies.sh
conda activate moose
export ENABLE_NEK=false
export HDF5_ROOT=$CONDA_PREFIX
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$CONDA_PREFIX/lib:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH
export LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/lib:$LIBRARY_PATH

with  echo $LIBRARY_PATH I now get  /usr/local/lib:/usr/local/lib:
But the error is still there.
fatal error: gsl/gsl-lite.hpp: No such file or directory

The gsl folder exists:
usr/local/lib/cmake/gsl-lite$ ls
gsl-lite-config.cmake  gsl-lite-config-version.cmake  gsl-lite-targets.cmake

@pshriwise thank you for helping!
here is the output file for:
~/Documents/DTU/MOOSE/cardinal/build/openmc$ make clean; make VERBOSE=1 | tee omc_verbose_make.txt


omc_verbose_make.txt

Interesting! From what I can tell, it looks like that build of OpenMC was successful.
FWIW here's the set of locations in the compile line where it's looking for headers (other than the default locations the compiler will look that aren't shown in the make command):
/home/philip/Documents/DTU/MOOSE/cardinal/contrib/openmc/include
/home/philip/Documents/DTU/MOOSE/cardinal/build/openmc/include 
/usr/local/include
/home/philip/mambaforge3/envs/moose/libmesh/include 
/home/philip/mambaforge3/envs/moose/libmesh-vtk/include/vtk-9.2

@philipJFpfahl, we believe this is happening due to the different build systems used by OpenMC and Cardinal. OpenMC uses CMake, whereas all MOOSE-based applications use Make. OpenMC is building fine with your system GSL, but those include dirs aren't propagated up to Cardinal, so it can't find it (this would be easy if MOOSE used CMake).
I think we have a hot fix for you, that forces OpenMC to build with its submodule GSL, which Cardinal should know how to find. Can you try editing the cardinal/contrib/openmc/CMakeLists.txt file to comment out this line, like:
#find_package_write_status(gsl-lite)

And then re-build:
cd cardinal
rm -rf build install
make -j4

Okay, first of all, I want to say a big thank you! It is amazing that you all put so much effort into solving this. An executable has been made and it passes all the tests. There were three more libraries missing:
   12 | #include "pugixml.hpp"

    8 | #include "fmt/format.h"

   14 | #include "xtensor/xadapt.hpp"


I also found them in the CMakeLists.txt and commented them out. And now it runs like a charm.
Super cool.
That's great! Thanks for sticking with us :) We really appreciate the feedback so we know how to make the build process more robust going forward.
Much appreciate it! Without the helping hands in the forum, MOOSE would only be half as useful.

node.title: convergence (polynomial vs log function) and a question about KKS model physics
node.bodyText:
Hello Moose Experts,
I tried to study KKS_system with a test example file,
/modules/phase_field/test/tests/KKS_system/kks_example_split.i
I have three questions.
1. Why does not the log bulk free energy function converge?

I changed the free energy function in the input file, kks_example_split.i just like below.

[Materials]
  # Free energy of the matrix
  [./fm]
    type = DerivativeParsedMaterial
    property_name = fm
    coupled_variables = 'cm'
    expression = '0.4009*(1.9956*cm+cm*log(cm)+(1-cm)*log(1-cm))+0.0441'
    outputs = exodus
  [../]

  # Free energy of the delta phase
  [./fd]
    type = DerivativeParsedMaterial
    property_name = fd
    coupled_variables = 'cd'
#    expression = '(0.9-cd)^2'
    expression = '0.4009*(-1.9956*cd+cd*log(cd)+(1-cd)*log(1-cd))+0.8441'
    outputs = exodus
  [../]


Before changes, they were polynomial functions like  '(0.9-cd)^2'.
I changed them because, in many papers (even the first proposal of KKS phase field model(S.Kim et al., PRE 60, 6, 1999)), log free energy function was used.
I don't know why this does not converge like below.

Time Step 1, time = 2.32831e-11, dt = 2.32831e-11
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_FNORM_NAN iterations 0
^[[31m Solve Did NOT Converge!^[[39m
Aborting as solve did not converge

Time Step 1, time = 1.16415e-11, dt = 1.16415e-11
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_FNORM_NAN iterations 0
^[[31m Solve Did NOT Converge!^[[39m
Aborting as solve did not converge

Time Step 1, time = 5.82077e-12, dt = 5.82077e-12
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_FNORM_NAN iterations 0
^[[31m Solve Did NOT Converge!^[[39m
Aborting as solve did not converge

Time Step 1, time = 2.91038e-12, dt = 2.91038e-12
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_FNORM_NAN iterations 0
^[[31m Solve Did NOT Converge!^[[39m
Aborting as solve did not converge

Time Step 1, time = 1.45519e-12, dt = 1.45519e-12
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_FNORM_NAN iterations 0
^[[31m Solve Did NOT Converge!^[[39m
Aborting as solve did not converge

Time Step 1, time = 7.27596e-13, dt = 7.27596e-13
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_FNORM_NAN iterations 0
^[[31m Solve Did NOT Converge!^[[39m
Aborting as solve did not converge

Time Step 1, time = 3.63798e-13, dt = 3.63798e-13
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_FNORM_NAN iterations 0
^[[31m Solve Did NOT Converge!^[[39m
Aborting as solve did not converge

Time Step 1, time = 1.81899e-13, dt = 1.81899e-13
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_FNORM_NAN iterations 0
^[[31m Solve Did NOT Converge!^[[39m
Aborting as solve did not converge

Time Step 1, time = 1e-13, dt = 1e-13
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_FNORM_NAN iterations 0
^[[31m Solve Did NOT Converge!^[[39m
Aborting as solve did not converge

For your information, I changed the polynomial function to the log function like below.
red +: original polynomial function
blue line: new log function (a1*(a2cm+cmlog(cm)+(1-cm)*log(1-cm))+a3), where a1, a2, and a3 are constants.


2. What makes the phase transition?
Three pictures below are the simulation results of the input file, kks_example_split.i at 0.1s, 20s, and 40s.



If I want the yellow region to grow all over the system and maintain, what should the Material property be?
For example, barrier height(w) is high and ...etc.
Also, It would be a great help if you let me know How I can make a rough guess before the simulation.
Thanks for reading this long discussion.
Best regard,
Jeonghwan.

Hello
For your first question, your expression will create NaNs if cm <= 0 or cm >= 1. Same for cd
0.4009*(1.9956cm+cmlog(cm)+(1-cm)*log(1-cm))+0.0441
So you need to bound cm and cd to make sure that does not happen.
We have created machinery in MOOSE to handle this.
In this material you will want to use tol_names and tol_values parameters to do this
Guillaume
Thanks for your help!

node.title: Getting velocity vector as an auxillary variable
node.bodyText:
Hello MOOSE experts,
I wanted to know whether it is possible to get the velocity vector as an auxillary variable. For example, solving the NS equation without using AD, but get velocity vector as an auxillary variable by its components. I know that the vice versa is possible, but not sure about this one.
Thanks,

Hello
You can extract every component from a vector variable using this:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/auxkernels/VectorVariableComponentAux.html
Guillaume
I meant vice versa. Storing a vector variable from components.
not rn. lemme add this

Hello
Please feel free to try this, the ParsedVectorAux
#24382
This will only set AUX variables.
If you need to set non linear ones, do this in a multiapp executed on initial on an auxvariable, then use a transfer to set the nonlinear varaible.
Guillaume

Thank you, but I could not compile it!
I am trying to couple the Navier stokes module to the level set equation. I already couple the navier stokes to the phase field, but I am getting unwanted mass loss. So here is my situation:

As we know level set is using AD, unfortunately when I couple AD-INS and level set, I get very bad results which means something is seriously wrong.
The main reason I am doing this is to use reinitialization. Is there non-AD code for levelset available to use?
Is it possible to get the velocities using non-AD INS, and pass the velocity vector to the level set module?

Thanks,
Ali

I don't think the answers to points 2 and 3 are very relevant. Whether the code is AD or not conceptually should only really relate to the computation of the Jacobian. Conceptually it's not really related to the results you get (which are determined by the residual statements). It's more important to address point 1. How are you measuring mass loss? Note that continuous finite elements are conservative on a per-nodal-patch basis as opposed to a per-element basis.

You are correct. But if level set was also available in non-AD like NS could be better. Because now that I am using ADINS and level set and seems that something is seriously wrong and I can't figure it out. I discuss the mass loss with more details here [https://github.com//discussions/24414].
I will also attach the input file here. I have not yet included the surface tension term, but something should be very wrong here.

[GlobalParams]
  enable_jit = true
  integrate_p_by_parts = true
[]



 rho_water = 1.000 #g/cm^3
 rho_air = 0.0012 #g/cm3

 mu_water = 0.0101 #g/(cm s)
 mu_air = 0.000182 #g/(cm s)

 epsilon= ${fparse 0.096/200}






[Mesh]
[gen]
  type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
  dim = 2
  nx = 300
  ny = 150
  nz = 0
  xmin = -0.5
  ymin = 0
  zmin = 0
  xmax = 0.5
  ymax = 0.5
  zmax = 0
  elem_type = QUAD4
  []

  [./corner_node]
    type = ExtraNodesetGenerator
    new_boundary = 'pinned_node'
    nodes = '0'
    input = gen
  [../]
[]

[AuxVariables]

  [./x_coor]
  [../]
  [./y_coor]
  [../]


[]






[Variables]

  [./velocity]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE_VEC
  [../]



# pressure for the NS module
  [./p]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
  [../]

#########
#level set
#########
  [./phi]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
  [../]




[]
[ICs]
  [./phi_IC]
    type = FunctionIC
    function = phi_exact
    variable = phi
  [../]
  [./vel_ic]
    type = VectorFunctionIC
    variable = velocity
    function = velocity_func
  []

[]

[Functions]
  [./velocity_func]
    type = ParsedVectorFunction
    expression_x = 'r:=(((x-0.0)/1)^2+((y-0.15)/1)^2);if(r<=0.009216,1e-15,1e-15)'
    expression_y = 'r:=(((x-0.0)/1)^2+((y-0.15)/1)^2);if(r<=0.009216,-62.0,1e-15)'
  [../]
      [./phi_exact]
    type = LevelSetOlssonBubble
    epsilon = ${epsilon}
    center = '0 0.15 0'
    radius = 0.096
  [../]
[]



  [AuxKernels]

    [./x_coor]
    type = FunctionAux
    variable = x_coor
    function = x
  [../]
        [./y_coor]
      type = FunctionAux
      variable = y_coor
      function = y
    [../]
[]

[Kernels]

#########
# 2D axisymmetric Navier-Stokes kernels: mass, momentum time and space
#########
  [./mass]
    type = INSADMass
    variable = p
  [../]
  [./mass_pspg]
    type = INSADMassPSPG
    variable = p
  [../]

  [./momentum_convection]
    type = INSADMomentumAdvection
    variable = velocity
  [../]

  [./momentum_viscous]
    type = INSADMomentumViscous
    variable = velocity
  [../]

  [./momentum_pressure]
    type = INSADMomentumPressure
    variable = velocity
    pressure = p
    integrate_p_by_parts = true
  [../]

  [./momentum_supg]
    type = INSADMomentumSUPG
    variable = velocity
    velocity = velocity
  [../]



  #[./SurfaceTension]
  #  type = ADSurfaceTension
  #  variable = velocity
  # coef = ${K}
  ##  c = c
   # w = w
  #[../]

  #########
  # the LEVEL SET kernels
  #########

  [./time]
    type = TimeDerivative
    variable = phi
 [../]
  [./advection]
    type = LevelSetAdvection
    velocity = velocity
    variable = phi
  [../]
  [./advection_supg]
    type = LevelSetAdvectionSUPG
    velocity = velocity
    variable = phi
  [../]
[]

[Materials]

#########
# setting up density and viscosity for the NS module
#########



   [rho]
    type = ADParsedMaterial
    property_name = rho
    expression = '${rho_water}*((phi)^2) + ${rho_air}*(( 1-phi)^2)'
    #expression = '1'
    coupled_variables = 'phi'
    block = '0'
    use_displced_mesh = true
        outputs = exodus

  []
  [mu]
    type = ADParsedMaterial
    property_name = mu
    expression = '${mu_water}*((phi)^2) + ${mu_air}*(( 1-phi)^2)'
    #expression = '1'
    coupled_variables = 'phi'
    block = '0'
    use_displaced_mesh = true
            outputs = exodus

  []




  [ins_mat]
    type = INSADTauMaterial
    velocity = velocity
    pressure = p
    rho = rho
    mu = mu
    block = 0
[]
[]


 







[BCs]




  [./no_slip]
    type = VectorFunctionDirichletBC
    variable = velocity
    boundary = 'bottom'
  [../]


 [p_corner]
    type = DirichletBC
    boundary = 'bottom'
    value = 0
    variable = p

[]


[]


[Preconditioning]
  active = preferred_but_might_not_be_installed                
  [basic]
    type = SMP
    full = true
    petsc_options = '-ksp_diagonal_scale -ksp_diagonal_scale_fix'
    petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -sub_pc_type -sub_pc_factor_shift_type -pc_asm_overlap'
    petsc_options_value = ' asm      lu           NONZERO                   2'
  []
  [preferred_but_might_not_be_installed]
    type = SMP
    full = true
    #petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_factor_mat_solver_package'
    #petsc_options_value = ' lu       mumps'

     #petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_asm_overlap -sub_pc_type -sub_pc_factor_levels -sub_pc_factor_shift_type'
 #petsc_options_value = 'asm      2               ilu          4                     NONZERO'

 #petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_factor_mat_solver_package -snes_type'
 #petsc_options_value = 'lu       superlu_dist                  vinewtonrsls'
 # petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_sub_type -ksp_gmres_restart'
  #petsc_options_value = 'hypre    boomeramg    300'

    petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_factor_shift_type'      
    petsc_options_value = 'lu       NONZERO'

  []
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  solve_type = NEWTON
# dt = 1e2  
  end_time = 0.5
  [./TimeStepper]
    type = PostprocessorDT
    postprocessor = cfl
    scale = 0.08
  [../]



  [./TimeIntegrator]
    #type = ExplicitTVDRK2

     type = ImplicitEuler
    # type = BDF2
    #type = CrankNicolson
    # type = ImplicitMidpoint
    # type = LStableDirk2
    # type = LStableDirk3
    # type = LStableDirk4
    #type = AStableDirk4
    #
    # Explicit methods
    # type = ExplicitEuler
    # type = ExplicitMidpoint
    # type = Heun
    # type = Ralston

  [../]


  nl_rel_tol = 1e-15
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-15
  #nl_max_its = 15

  l_tol = 1e-15
  #l_max_its = 10
  automatic_scaling = true
[]


[Outputs]
  exodus = true
  #  interval = 50
  csv = true

  [out]
    type = Checkpoint
    interval = 500
    num_files = 2
  []

[]



#[Adaptivity]
#  initial_steps = 6
#  steps = 1
#  marker = error
#  [Indicators]
#    [jump]
#      type = GradientJumpIndicator
#      variable = c
#    []
#  []
#  [Markers]
#    [error]
#      type = ErrorFractionMarker
#      coarsen = 0.5
#      refine = 0.9
#      indicator = jump
#    []
#  []
#  max_h_level = 6
#[]



[Postprocessors]
  [./area]
    type = LevelSetVolume
    threshold = 0.5
    variable = phi
    location = outside
    execute_on = 'initial timestep_end'
  [../]
  [./cfl]
    type = LevelSetCFLCondition
    velocity = velocity
    execute_on = 'initial' #timestep_end'
  [../]

  [./total_sol]
    type = ElementIntegralVariablePostprocessor
    variable = phi
  [../]
[]

Thank you, but I could not compile it!

It's part of MOOSE now. So it definitely compiles. You could try to update MOOSE (and libmesh) and use it.

I am trying to couple the Navier stokes module to the level set equation. I already couple the navier stokes to the phase field, but I am getting unwanted mass loss. So here is my situation:


As we know level set is using AD, unfortunately when I couple AD-INS and level set, I get very bad results which means something is seriously wrong.

You need to start small on this kind of things.
For example:

decouple the physics one way and work to obtain known solutions
reproduce known 1D numerical or analytical solutions


The main reason I am doing this is to use reinitialization. Is there non-AD code for levelset available to use?

As Alex said this is not related. You can use reinitialization whether velocities are AD or not. You ll just need the extra steps I've explained (parsed vector aux (+ multiapps if solving for velocities)).
Thank you. The kernel works well.

node.title: Segmentation fault on pre-split mesh
node.bodyText:
Hi,
I typically use pre-split meshes as (just like in  #23713) my mesh is large and I cannot replicate (will run out of RAM). Pre-splitting has worked well with previous installations but after I updated and rebuilt MOOSE on May 3, including Libmesh and PETSc, I get errors:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Primary job  terminated normally, but 1 process returned
a non-zero exit code. Per user-direction, the job has been aborted.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
mpirun noticed that process rank 57 with PID 1637367 on node node05 exited on signal 11 (Segmentation fault).
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is uniquely related to pre-splitting (I have some nodes on which I can use replicated mesh and then this error does not happen) and uniquely related to the update on May 3.
Any ideas of what is going on?

Hello
Do you use multiapps?
From when was your last working version? so we can narrow down which PR changed it
Do you see anything helpful in debug mode? (just compiled in debug mode first, but running in a debugger could get us even more info)
Guillaume

Hi Guillaume. No multiapps - just usual stuff and a UserObject. Haven't run debug mode - I'll see if I get around to it (busy cranking out results so may not have time for a while to dig into debug).
I pulled the MOOSE, Libmesh, and PETSc (updating Libmesh and PETSc using the MOOSE scripts) on May 3. Here is the Framework information:
Framework Information:
MOOSE Version:           git commit 2da0ccf on 2023-04-11
LibMesh Version:         80494219d2293e467392189814d30330c4f87a25
PETSc Version:           3.16.6
SLEPc Version:           3.16.2
do you have the hash for the working version? Presumably just the previous one you used
it will be in any simulation log

It looks like this is related to the number of processes (MPI tasks). When I split 96 ways (96 cores in the node) I get the seg fault, but when I split 64 ways, things seem to work. I tried to split 96 ways using 8 or 16 tasks so as not to overwhelm RAM during splitting so I don't think that I ran out of RAM - looks like something else going on.

We've changed a lot of things in how often we prepare the mesh (search for elem neighbors, delete remote elements, repartition) to do it as little as possible
This is probably tied. Can you share your mesh? or can you make a MWE?
I am afraid I cannot share the mesh (IP). What's MWE?

minimal (non) working example
If you can reproduce this error with a MOOSE mesh or anything else you can share
I'll see if I can mock up some MWE. Isn't the hash MOOSE Version: git commit 2da0ccf on 2023-04-11? Is it something else?
That's for the working version then?
That's the current version I am running that sometimes splits successfully, sometimes not.

We've changed a lot of things in how often we prepare the mesh (search for elem neighbors, delete remote elements, repartition) to do it as little as possible

I think the changes we merged ensure that we prepare the mesh at least as much as before and sometimes more. The "more" preparing has revealed some buggy behavior both in MOOSE and in libMesh that we've worked quickly to fix. I know there is at least one outstanding issue on the libMesh side that @roystgnr is working on. Perhaps he can comment on how often he thinks that might crop up in real user cases

The only thing that I know we're not doing right yet is making sure that an already-constructed PointLocator gets reconstructed after mesh node positions are changed in the middle of a chain of mesh generators.  That's not going to be an easy case to hit, though; you'd need a mesh generator that uses a point locator, whose mesh is then fed to a generator that moves points, whose mesh is then fed to another generator that uses a point locator ... and even then you'd need the final generator to not do any kind of null-checking on the element returned by the locator.  That combination is probably not what's happening here.

node.title: How to transfer element values from multiapps to master?
node.bodyText:
Hello developers
I currently have a master and multiple multiapps, and l need to pass the element value from one of the multiapps to the maste. However, when I used type = MultiAppNearestNodeTransfer in the [transfers] of the master, I found that the element value cannot be effectively passed, but when l change the element value to another node value, the value can be effectively passed.
lt seems that type = MultiAppNearestNodeTransfer can only pass node values. Does anyone know how to pass element values?
master.i
[Transfers]
  [A_from_multi]
    type = MultiAppNearestNodeTransfer
    direction = from_multiapp
    multi_app = multi_A
    source_variable = A
    variable = A
  []
[]

Hello
MultiAppNearestNodeTransfer was not well named.
It actually defaults to passing the element centroid value for Constant Monomial variables.
It's on my to-do list to rename it.
Guillaume

*** Info ***

/home/lwz/.conda/envs/moose/libmesh/include/metaphysicl/dynamic_std_array_wrapper.h, line 125, compiled May 20 2023 at 04:09:33
libMesh terminating:
Error in MetaPhysicL internal logic
application called MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1) - process 0
[unset]: write_line error; fd=-1 buf=:cmd=abort exitcode=1
:
system msg for write_line failure : Bad file descriptor

I updated the MOOOSE environment and recompiled MOOSE but it didn't work

Can you share your input file? You should be getting a more detailed error message.
This test requires an automatic differentiation container size that is larger than the default. You need to cd into the root of your MOOSE directory and do
./configure --with-derivative-size=300

and then recompile. Sorry for the trouble!
Thank for your help，I didn't change the code for this test，I have successfully run this test when I modified  --with-derivative-size
Oh yea, dumb question by me. Thank you for reporting this!
I've created issue #24444 and a pull request #24445 to give more information out for this automatically in the future
nice！It would be really helpful to other people. Mortar is a great model will be used more!

node.title: Laserwelding (2D) simulation with MALAMUTE
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
I was trying out the recently open-sourced MALAMUTE app. Thanks to prompt replies from @jiangwen84, @lindsayad and @cticenhour , I could quickly set it up on my HPC. This is the result from the melt_pool.i example. It looked so good that I couldn't resist posting it 😄 .
Haha, thank you so much for sharing @KamalnathOSU !
Glad to to see your results. We are working on new models and other improvements. Will keep you posted.
